Wandering aimlessly about as though seeking out something but with no succe=
ss. It seemed to be searching for hours but the spark had no concept of tim=
e.  


As night fell upon the land, the spark returned like a prodigal chil=
d to Megatron X's location, to where it found shelter and energy. 

Floatin=
g through the halls and corridors - some darkened, some not - like a ghost,=
 it appeared almost as if to be exploring. But the light seemed to flicker =
and dim.

Finally the fiery spark returned to the chamber room where it was=
 being contained. Floating about the form that was still in consruction tha=
t would one day soon house the spark before returning to it's holding vat t=
hat nutured it and protected it. 
Within the containment, it settled, float=
ing there, slightly pulsing then stopped as it remained a steady glow. 

Th=
en a ghostly sweet reversed echo was heard, "Where are you?" it softly call=
ed, the tone sad and pain filled, as though alone. All alone. But who was t=
he voice was referring to or calling out to? 



> 
> 
> Even the mighty ne=
eded a respite, and Megatron X was no different. He had watched over the sp=
ark and the slow manufacture of it's new body. He had not gone far, now sta=
nding still in an alcove in a dark lightly room. Cables, hoses, and clamps =
held him in place, replacing coolant in his systems, replenishing his energ=
on and refueling his weapons. It was cold, his form now could as ice with a=
 low fog hangin over his form. 
> =A0
> It was after the stanger left that =
he notified. Still physically immobilized, his consciousness came online an=
d accessed the base's internal and external security network. Scans indicat=
ed the spark had competed it's body, and now had left. Odd, he not think it=
 would be able to do so. Perhaps it knew his security codes, or simply brok=
e out. Switching to external sensors, he scanned all of the island of Hokka=
ido for signs of his guest.

atron?" the femme voice replied almost in disbelief.

a moment as though it were contemplating or something else. But definitely =
feeding off the energon. 
> > "I am most grateful for the energon and the r=
escue." That calm deep femme voice stated. "And honored to once again be in=
 thy presense, oh, mighty Megatron." Her voice sincere to every degree. The=
re was only one whom she respected 100%... and that was Megatron.

m forever in your debt."

ar in the heavens.

> Silence overtook the vicinity once more. Darkne=
ss and silence. Not that it was a bad thing... but it wasn't a good thing e=
ither. 
> The spark pulsed from time to time, feeding off the energy that w=
as offered to it, recovering. 
> It had recovered enough strength for the t=
ime being. Some sparks recalled past memories. It took some time, but this =
particular spark was able to recall much. The last moments it was functioni=
ng or alive was as some predacon to assasinate someone. And a name, a face,=
 a sensation seemed to reverberate causing the spark to pulse.
> 
> Nearby =
the spark, a chassis was being constructed. A large one. One nearly the hei=
ght of the original Megatron. As drone parts worked furiously upon the chas=
sis, the spark pulsed moreso. The containment that held it, nurtured it, op=
ened and out floated the spark. 
> 
> Like a ghost, it wandered about befor=
e leaving the facility. For the time being, the spark had forgotten about i=
t's rescuer. But it would return. Soon or eventually.
